description: Romano-British settlement beginning in the conquest period with what is described as a 'substantial central shrine area'. Apparently abandoned some time in the 4th CE, though the settlement continued.
bibliography: Atkinson, M, and S Preston. “Hidden Heybridge. The Elms Farm Excavation: The Story of One of the Most Important Archaeological Investigations of Recent Times.” Essex County Council Essex County, 2000.
———. “The Late Iron Age and Roman Settlement at Elms Farm, Heybridge, Essex, Excavations 1993–5: An Interim Report.” Britannia 29 (1995).
